intro: Morierina propinqua, commonly known as the slender morierina, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
